com.novell.ldapchai
Class ChaiFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.novell.ldapchai.ChaiFactory

public final class ChaiFactory
extends Object

Factory for ChaiEntry and its subclasses. Instances are returned based on the supplied ChaiProvider's settings and state. In particular, ChaiProvider.getDirectoryVendor() is called, and an implementing class appropriate for the vendor type is used.

For clarity the "create" methods in this class create instances of ChaiEntry. They do not actualy create a new entry in the ldap directory.

ChaiProvider instances can be obtained using the ChaiProviderFactory factory.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

                                        ChaiProvider provider)
                                 throws ChaiUnavailableException
Returns a ChaiEntry instance representing the supplied entryDN.

Parameters:
entryDN - A valid ldap entry DN (Distinguished Name) of an entry
provider - A valid and functioning ChaiProvider. The ChaiProvider's ldap connection will be used by the ChaiEntry.
Returns:
A valid ChaiEntry
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException

quickProvider

public static ChaiUser quickProvider(String ldapURL,
                                     String bindDN,
                                     String password)
                              throws ChaiUnavailableException
Convenience method for ChaiProviderFactory.quickProvider(String,String,String).

Get a ChaiUser using a standard JNDI ChaiProvider with default settings.

Parameters:
bindDN - ldap bind DN, in ldap fully qualified syntax. Also used as the DN of the returned ChaiUser.
password - password for the bind DN.
ldapURL - ldap server and port in url format, example: ldap://127.0.0.1:389
Returns:
A ChaiUser instance of the bindDN with an underlying ChaiProvider connected using the supplied parameters.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are not reachable.
See Also:
(String, String, String)
